page.title: 05Typical farm,north Upottery.
page.content:
A working farmer,whose land lies in the middle of the valley area,says that his farm carries 60 cows,mostly Friesians with a few Ayrshires.He reckons to produce about 260 litres at each milking,which is collected for the Milk Marketing Board and taken to Chard in the blue tankers we see often in our lanes. He also keeps 10 sows,whose piglets he sells when they are about 10 weeks old,together with any calves,in the markets at either Honiton,Axminster or Taunton. In the winter he buys in 50 sheep from Scotland for fattening. Poultry he keeps only for the family table.
For his crops see next page.
